title: Hackerone All Private Program Name Leaked to Public Via Collaborator OR Attacker can Easily Dump all Private Program Names through Collaborator

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Team,

I hope you are doing well.

I found a Critical Vulnerability using this attacker can easily dump all the private program names of Hackerone and it breaks the confidentiality because if attacker got name of the program Rest of the Data is not needed because it's googleable about the program.

I found that Using Collaborator Feature attacker can easily got all Program's Names one by one or he can automate through Burp Intruder.

Steps to Reproduce :- 1. Create a Report on Hackerone in which Collaboration is allowed.
2. After creating it add a Random Collaborator and Capture this Request in Burp suite.
3. In the Request there is `report_id` change this id to `2052164`.
4. You got this error if program is Public :- 

█████

5. Now change this `report_id` change this id to `2052163 ,  2052158 , 2052154 , 2052162 , 2053029`.
6. As these all `report_id ` belongs to private programs you got leaked Name of Private program Like :- 

██████

█████████

7. Attacker can easily Brute-Force through intruder and Dump the whole DB of Private Hackerone program Name this breaks the Confidentially of Private program because if Someone known name he can easily google and find it the information about it.

## Impact

1. Broken Confidentiality of Hackerone Feature about Private Programs.
2. Attacker can easily dump all the Private program Names and it also breaks the Confidentiality between Hackerone and Client.

POC Attached

If you need further info I am here to help you.

Thanks and Regards,
BhaRat

Could you please provide affected raw request?

I hope you are doing well.


Hi @zerotea ,

Thanks for the Response.

I also Request you to please increase the severity to HIGH, because Private program name leaking is it's a HIGH severity problem because for Researcher only program name is there for invite and everything . If attacker got the name he can directly contact to program and also it breaks the Hackerone Confidentiality of data and   clients Trust.

If you need any further info I am here to help you.

Thanks and Regards,
BhaRat

Hi @hackit_bharat - 

We have not evaluated the severity yet, but typically the fact something is invite-only or private is not high in itself. Only when you can leak more than the status of the program.

See relevant snippets from the Policy here (https://hackerone.com/security):

>Vulnerabilities that disclose the existence of a launched private HackerOne program (not a "sandboxed" or demo program) will be considered Low severity, whereas previously they would be considered Medium severity. Depending on the information that is disclosed, the team may increase the severity.

>Existence of invite-only programs
>HackerOne has six different program states that are important to understand: sandbox, invite-only, public, external program, external program + sandbox, and external program + invite-only. It is only a valid vulnerability when there is a difference between the sandbox and invite-only programs. It is not a vulnerability when you can't distinguish a sandboxed program from an invite-only program. You can use the following example program handles for your tests.

I hope that helps.

The team will work on a fix, and a re-test will be requested when they have deployed it.

Note again that if the only thing we can expose is the status of a program being private or not, the severity will be considered Low as per our policy.

>Vulnerabilities that disclose the existence of a launched private HackerOne program (not a "sandboxed" or demo program) will be considered Low severity.
Thanks for bringing this to our attention, I'm awarding $500 since the bug has been confirmed. We may increase this in the future if you can prove more than only private status being leaked.

Hi @zerotea ,

Thanks for the quick Response. 

But I am able to get the information/Names of Private and invite only Hackerone Programs . I am sure it's not Sandboxed because I reported to some private programs which is invite only and I replace the report number for that for testing in my POC and it's also leaking their names which I am sure that it's Invite only private programs.

I hope this will help.

If you need any further info I am here to help you.

Thanks and Regards,
BhaRat

I request you to please Reevaluate the Report severity and Bounty.

And also it's Marked as Medium Severity and Reward for Medium Severity is 2500$.

Thanks and Regards,
BhaRat

Hi @zerotea ,

I hope you are doing well. 

I see some Reports like #1869613 in which one private program name is leaked and it's given with 500$ and I am able to dump whole DB of private program names and still it's same I am totally insatisfied with that Team.

If you need all private program ames , I will dump and send you. Please increase the Reward amount.

Thanks and Regards,
BhaRat

Like I said in my bounty reward, 

>We may increase this in the future if you can prove more than only private status being leaked.

I awarded a $500 initial bounty because it's guaranteed; but I was probably too fast on the trigger. I think there's just a miscommunication, $500 is not the final bounty, it's just an already guaranteed amount I can award now, and if that increases it will change once we're done with the rest of the process.

I apologize if that  caused some distress, I can see how the intention might be misinterpreted as final decision, but I can guarantee you it's not - we just haven't had the time to validate severity or the policy case completely yet.

BTW: no, you do not have permission to dump all program names, and I don't need them either to confirm the validity of the bug further.

Hi @zerotea ,

I hope you are doing well.

Thanks for the kind Response. I appreciate your kind behavior.

Meanwhile, I will close the mediation request and Thanks again for your support.

I will wait for your Response regarding the final decision , severity and Reward.

Thanks and Regards,
BhaRat

I had an internal question posted but it went by unanswered and kind of fell in the abyss, I will re-raise this question.
In a bit of an unconvential way of working, I also see a fix has already been applied and merged 3 weeks ago, so I will also prompt a retest in the meantime.

As agreed upon, we agree a directory attack is more severe than a low. Sorry it took so long to get there!

To clarify on what took so long:

There were some discussions surrounding the following part in our policy:

>Vulnerabilities that disclose the existence of a launched private HackerOne program (not a "sandboxed" or demo program) will be considered Low severity.

We agreed that this case does not warrant capping to a low and thus a medium bounty has been awarded.

In addition, the internal tracking ticket had the wrong state and got lost into the abyss, mediation alerted us about this report.

Sorry about this all, happy hacking!
I think I redacted everything, please take a look and consider disclosure if you agree :)

Hi @zerotea ,

Thanks for Quick Response and Bounty. 

I appreciate your quick Responses and Thanks again for the Bounty.

I also checked the report , Nothing Sensitive here we can Disclose that. 

Thanks and Regards,
BhaRat

summaries.content:
The hacker was able to perform a directory attack over reports to validate whether or not a program was private.

If it was, it would say "foo is not yet invited to <HANDLE>,  which is a private program."

If the program was public, you would get "You do not have the appropriate access"

user.name: zerotea
user.bio: Hacker, Board Games enthousiast, mostly human and definitely not a robot. Software Engineer at HackerOne. They/them
